unnormalised: It was a typical Sunday morning in Mumbai. Amma asked me to get the groceries for the week from the local market. She handed me a list: "1 kg potatoes, ½ kg tomatoes, 250 gms coriander, and 1 ltr milk." I grabbed my jhola and headed out, already dreading the crowds.
normalised: It was a typical Sunday morning in Mumbai. Amma asked me to get the groceries for the week from the local market. She handed me a list: "one kilogram potatoes, half kilogram tomatoes, two hundred and fifty grams coriander, and one liter milk." I grabbed my jhola and headed out, already dreading the crowds.

unnormalised: The market was bustling as usual. First stop, the vegetable vendor. "Bhaiyya, aloo kaise hai?" I asked. He quoted Rs. 40/kg. I haggled a bit, managing to bring it down to Rs. 35/kg. Next, I needed the tomatoes. They were selling for Rs. 60 per ½ kg. “Too much!” I exclaimed, eventually settling for Rs. 50/ ½ kg. The coriander was next, a small bunch for Rs. 20 for 250 gms, seemed reasonable enough.
normalised: The market was bustling as usual. First stop, the vegetable vendor. "Bhaiyya, aloo kaise hai?" I asked. He quoted rupees forty per kilogram. I haggled a bit, managing to bring it down to rupees thirty five per kilogram. Next, I needed the tomatoes. They were selling for rupees sixty per half kilogram. “Too much!” I exclaimed, eventually settling for rupees fifty per half kilogram. The coriander was next, a small bunch for rupees twenty for two hundred and fifty grams, seemed reasonable enough.

unnormalised: Moving on to the dairy section, I spotted the Amul booth. A 1 ltr pack of toned milk cost Rs. 56. The vendor was busy attending to other customers, so I picked up the carton and moved towards the billing counter. I also needed to pick up paneer. The list said 200 gms.
normalised: Moving on to the dairy section, I spotted the Amul booth. A one liter pack of toned milk cost rupees fifty six. The vendor was busy attending to other customers, so I picked up the carton and moved towards the billing counter. I also needed to pick up paneer. The list said two hundred grams.

unnormalised: After the dairy, I remembered Amma needed some spices. So I went to the spice stall. The vendor had all kinds of masalas on display. I got 100 gms of turmeric powder for Rs. 30 and 50 gms of chili powder for Rs. 25.
normalised: After the dairy, I remembered Amma needed some spices. So I went to the spice stall. The vendor had all kinds of masalas on display. I got one hundred grams of turmeric powder for rupees thirty and fifty grams of chili powder for rupees twenty five.

unnormalised: Finally, I had everything on the list. The jhola was heavy, weighing probably around 3 kgs. I paid the vegetable vendor Rs. 85 for the potatoes, tomatoes and coriander, then paid Rs 111 for the milk, paneer and spices.
normalised: Finally, I had everything on the list. The jhola was heavy, weighing probably around three kilograms. I paid the vegetable vendor rupees eighty five for the potatoes, tomatoes and coriander, then paid rupees one hundred and eleven for the milk, paneer and spices.

unnormalised: Walking back home, I calculated that I had spent approximately Rs. 196 for everything. Amma would be happy; I had managed to get everything on her list without exceeding the budget she set. I just hoped I wouldn't have to make another trip before the next Sunday.
normalised: Walking back home, I calculated that I had spent approximately rupees one hundred and ninety six for everything. Amma would be happy; I had managed to get everything on her list without exceeding the budget she set. I just hoped I wouldn't have to make another trip before the next Sunday.
